task.title: Task: New table with Excel import
task.shortdesc: How to import an Excel worksheet as a new Access table.

taskbody.context: Access works well with Excel. So you can import an entire worksheet in a new or an existing table.

step.cmd: Choose tab External Data New Data Source (group Import & Link) From File Excel .

fig.title: Dialog box Get External Data - Excel Spreadsheet

image.alt: Dialog box Get External Data - Excel Spreadsheet.

step.cmd: Navigate with the button Browse to the file transport.xlsx.
Select the first option Import the source data into a new table in the current database and click OK.
Select the option First Row Contains Column Headings and click Next.
step.stepresult: In the wizard screen that appears now, several characteristics of the fields can be changed.
The wizard asks now what should be used as a key for the new table.

step.cmd: Select No primary key and click Next.
step.stepresult: The wizard then asks for the name of the table.

step.cmd: Specify the name Transport for the table and click Finish.
step.stepresult: The wizard now shows that the data is imported from Excel.

step.cmd: Open the table, look at the result, and close the table.
